text: James Anthony "Tony" Brown (born 5 January 1950) is a Manx politician. He is the current Chief Minister of the Isle of ManmyGov.im New Chief Minister of the Isle of Man and Member of the House of Keys for Castletown. Tony Brown was educated at Castle Rushen and was an electrician. He owned Tony Brown Electrics in Castletown until its closure in 2010.Isle of Man's chief minister to shut Castletown shop He was elected as a member of Castletown Commissioners (town council) in 1976, becoming Chairman in 1980 before being elected as the Castletown MHK in 1981 at his first attempt. In 2000, he was defeated in his attempt to become Speaker of the House of Keys by David Cannan but instead became the Deputy Speaker. Following the 2001 General Election, he was elected Speaker and in January 2002, Deputy President of Tynwald. He was reelected in November 2006 as MHK, beating Roy Redmayne by 915 votes to 335. ==Governmental positions== *Minister of Health and Social Security, 1986–89 *Minister of Local Government and the Environment, 1989–94 *Minister of Tourism and Leisure, 1994–96 *Minister of Transport, 1996–2001 *Chief Minister, 2006– ==Brown Council== Office Name Term Chief Minister Tony Brown 2006–Present Minister of the Treasury Allan Bell 2001–2008 Minister of the Treasury Anne Craine 2008–present Minister of Home Affairs Martyn Quayle 2006–08 Minister of Home Affairs Adrian Earnshaw 2008–Present Minister of Health and Social Security Eddie Teare 2006–Present Minister of Education Annie Craine 2006–Present Minister of Trade and Industry David Cretney 2006–Present Minister of Tourism and Leisure Adrian Earnshaw 2006–08 Minister of Tourism and Leisure Martyn Quayle 2008–Present Minister of Transport David Anderson 2006–Present Minister of Agriculture, Fisheries and Forestry Phil Gawne 2005–Present Minister of Local Government and the Environment John Shimmin 2006–Present ==References== Category:1950 births Category:Living people Category:Manx politicians
